metadata.title: CVE-2024-26925 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:netfilter: nf_tables: release mutex after nft_gc_seq_end from abort pathThe commit mutex should not be released during the critical section betweennft_gc_seq_begin() and nft_gc_seq_end(), otherwise, async GC worker couldcollect expired objects and get the released commit lock within the same GCsequence. nf_tables_module_autoload() temporarily releases the mutex toload module dependencies, then it goes back to replay the transactionagain. Move it at the end of the abort phase after nft_gc_seq_end() iscalled.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26925` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500 - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500mc - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-smp - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-emb - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-smp - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.11.0-12.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1

linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
